thread.title: Chef Jacques Pepin being honored in Washington
thread.title_full: Chef Jacques Pepin being honored in Washington

author: wtopstaff
title: Chef Jacques Pepin being honored in Washington
text:
Home » News » Entertainment » Chef Jacques Pepin being… Chef Jacques Pepin being honored in Washington By The Associated Press October 22, 2015 1:04 pm 
WASHINGTON (AP) — The Smithsonian’s National Museum of American History is hosting a gala dinner in honor of chef Jacques Pepin as part of its Food History Weekend. 
On Thursday evening, Pepin will be presented with the Julia Child Foundation for Gastronomy and the Culinary Arts’ inaugural Julia Child Award. The dinner’s emcee will be Food Network chef Alton Brown. Chefs Marcus Samuelsson and Sara Moulton will speak about Child’s influence. The dinner’s menu was created by French chef Daniel Boulud. 
The dinner is the first of three days of events at the Smithsonian. On Friday, the Smithsonian is hosting a day-long food history symposium, and on Saturday, the museum is hosting a series of free events including cooking demonstrations and culinary book signings. Topics:
